Package com.tknkla.rj

Class RJ

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tknkla.rj.RJ
  • public final class RJ
extends Object
    Elementary algorithms and related utilities for relative programming.

    Majority of the algorithms are parallelized. All such algorithms are marked with (P) in the documentation.

    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Timo Santasalo

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static int[] EMPTY_INT
      An empty array of ints.
      static long[] EMPTY_LONG
      An empty array of longs.
      static IntBinaryPredicate UNDIRECTED_COMPLETE
      A complete graph; returns true for all non-equal pairs of arguments.
      static IntBinaryPredicate UNDIRECTED_EMPTY
      An empty graph; always returns false.

    • Method Detail

      • setExecutor

        public static void setExecutor​(ExecutionStrategy xs)
        Sets the global parallelization strategy.

        Note that as the parallelization configuration is global, no programming library (using RJ), but only the final application using RJ either directly or indirectly, should ever configure the parallelization strategy.

        Parameters:
        xs - The parallelization strategy.
        Since:
        1.0.0
        See Also:
        ExecutionStrategy.LOCAL, ExecutionStrategy.PARALLEL

      • getExecutor

        public static ExecutionStrategy getExecutor()
        Returns the global parallelization strategy.
        Returns:
        The parallelization strategy.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • execute

        public static void execute​(int from,
                           int to,
                           IntConsumer fn)
        (P) Executes a lambda for all arguments within range (in undefined order).
        Parameters:
        from - Start of the execution range (inclusive).
        to - End of the execution range (exclusive).
        fn - Lambda to be executed (with all arguments within the execution range).
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • execute

        public static int execute​(int from,
                          int to,
                          int id,
                          IntUnaryOperator fv,
                          IntBinaryOperator fm)
        (P) Executes a lambda for all arguments within range (in undefined order) and combines the result with an associative operator.
        Parameters:
        from - Start of the execution range (inclusive).
        to - End of the execution range (exclusive).
        id - Identity element (to be returned if from>=to).
        fv - Lambda to executed (with all arguments within the execution range).
        fm - Associative operator (for merging results).
        Returns:
        Result of the operation.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • order

        public static int[] order​(int ln,
                          IntUnaryOperator fv,
                          IntBinaryOperator cmp,
                          IntBinaryOperator fm)
        (P) Computes absolute order for/sorts a number of ints; equivalent items are merged using the supplied function.
        Parameters:
        ln - Number of items to be sorted.
        fv - Supplies the nth item to be sorted.
        cmp - Comparator function.
        fm - Merge function (for equivalent items; may be null if there are no equivalent items).
        Returns:
        The sorted array.
        Since:
        1.0.0

                            int ln,
                            IntFunction<T> fv,

      • groups

        public static int[][] groups​(int ln,
                             IntUnaryOperator fv,
                             IntBinaryOperator ocmp,
                             IntBinaryOperator icmp)
        (P) Computes absolute order for/sorts a number of ints; equivalent items are grouped into arrays.
        Parameters:
        ln - Number of items to be sorted.
        fv - Supplies the nth item to be sorted.
        ocmp - Outer comparator (for splitting).
        icmp - Inner comparator (for equivalent items; if null, the order between equivalent items is preserved).
        Returns:
        The sorted array of arrays.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • groups

                              IntToLongFunction fv,
                              LongToIntBinaryOperator ocmp,
                              LongToIntBinaryOperator icmp)

        Parameters:

        fv - Supplies the nth item to be sorted.
        ocmp - Outer comparator (for splitting).
        icmp - Inner comparator (for equivalent items; if null, the order between equivalent items is preserved).

        The sorted array of arrays.
        Since:
        1.0.0

        public static <T> T[][] groups​(Class<? extends T> rc,
                               int ln,
                               IntFunction<T> fv,
                               Comparator<T> ocmp,
                               Comparator<T> icmp)
        (P) Computes absolute order for/sorts a number of objects; equivalent items are grouped into arrays.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Item type.
        Parameters:
        rc - Item type.
        ln - Number of items to be sorted.
        fv - Supplies the nth item to be sorted.
        ocmp - Outer comparator (for splitting).
        icmp - Inner comparator (for equivalent items; if null, the order between equivalent items is preserved).
        Returns:
        The sorted array of arrays.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • propagate

        public static int[][] propagate​(int[][] src,
                                IntBinaryOperator fg,
                                IntBinaryOperator cmp,
                                IntGroupOperator g,
                                Predicate<int[][]> fh)
        (P) Executes the iterative propagation part of relative order/comparision for a preorder of symbols expressed as ints.
        Parameters:
        src - A preorder of symbols.
        fg - Supplies the relative difference between a pair of symbols.
        cmp - Comparator for equivalent items; if null, the order between equivalent items is preserved.
        g - Group operator.
        fh - Halting condition; if null, iteration is repeated as long as differences are found.
        Returns:
        An order of symbols.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • compare

        public static int compare​(int a,
                          int b,
                          int[][] src,
                          IntBinaryOperator fg,
                          IntGroupOperator g)
        (P) Computes the relative order between a pair of symbols expressed as ints. Returns -1, 0 or 1, depending whether left symbol is less than (absolute), equivalent to (neutral) or more than (relative) the right symbol. If no order is done, input order is returned as is.
        Parameters:
        a - Left symbol.
        b - Right symbol.
        src - A preorder of symbols.
        fg - Supplies the relative difference between a pair of symbols.
        g - Group operator.
        Returns:
        Result of comparision (-1, 0 or 1).
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • merge

        public static int[] merge​(int n,
                          IntFunction<int[]> fn,
                          IntBinaryOperator cmp,
                          IntBinaryOperator fm,
                          SetOperator op)
        (P) Applies an anary set operation to an array of sets of ints.
        Parameters:
        n - Number of sets to merge.
        fn - Supplies nth set to merge.
        cmp - Comparator (both arguments must abide the order).
        fm - Merge function (for combining equivalent items).
        op - Symmetric set operation.
        Returns:
        The merged set.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • merge

        public static <T> T[] merge​(Class<? extends T> rc,
                            int n,
                            IntFunction<T[]> fn,
                            Comparator<T> cmp,
                            BinaryOperator<T> fm,
                            SetOperator op)
        (P) Applies an anary set operation to an array of sets of objects.

        Note that if the item type is a generic type, the lambdas must work with the raw types. For example, assuming there is a generic class SomeType<T> which implements Comparable<SomeType<T>> and lambda fn is of type IntFunction<SomeType<T>>, then: 

        

        

        Type Parameters:
        

        T - Item type.
        

        Parameters:
        

        rc - Item type.
        

        n - Number of sets to merge.
        

        fn - Supplies nth set to merge.
        

        cmp - Comparator (both arguments must abide the order).
        

        fm - Merge function (for combining equivalent items).
        

        op - Symmetric set operation.
        

        Returns:
        

        The merged set.
        

        Since:
        

        1.0.0

        randomBinary
        

        public static IntPredicate randomBinary​(int ln,
                                        double density,
                                        double limit,
                                        Random rnd)
        

        Generates a randomized string of bits.
 Propability that a bit is set is limit + (1-2*limit)*density.
        

        

        Parameters:
        

        ln - Number of random bits to return.
        

        density - Density (0.0 to 1.0, or NaN for random density).
        

        limit - Density limit.
        

        rnd - Random number generator.
        

        Returns:
        

        A random string of bits as a predicate.
        

        Since:
        

        1.0.0
        

        

        • 

      




        

      •

        search
        

        public static int search​(int from,
                         int to,
                         IntUnaryOperator fn)
        

        Binary search with input supplied as a lambda which is called for every index
 to be evaluated.
 
 
        Example: int rt = search(0, items.length, (int p) -> items[p].compareTo(item));
        

        

        Parameters:
        

        from - Start of range (inclusive).
        

        to - End of range (exclusive).
        

        fn - Lambda to be called for every index to be evaluated; returns 0 if argument is a result; -1 if result is after the argument or 1 if it is before the argument.
        

        Returns:
        

        Result index; if no result is found, binary negation of the index, where the result should exists, is returned.
        

        Since:
        

        1.0.0
        

        

        • 

      




        

      • 

        search
        

        public static int search​(int from,
                         int to,
                         IntPredicate fn)
        

        Linear search with input supplied as a lambda which is called for every index
 to be evaluated; returns first match.
 
 
        If the start of the range is less than the end of the range the search is reversed.
        

        

        Parameters:
        

        from - Start of range (inclusive).
        

        to - End of range (exclusive).
        

        fn - Predicate; returns true if argument is a result.
        

        Returns:
        

        Result index; if no result is found, the next index after last (to be searched) is returned.
        

        Since:
        

        1.0.0
        

        

        • 

      




        

      • 

        search
        

        public static int search​(int from,
                         int to,
                         IntBinaryPredicate fn)
        

        Linear search with input supplied as a lambda which is called for every index
 to be evaluated; returns best match.
 
 
        If the start of the range is less than the end of the range the search is reversed.
        

        

        Parameters:
        

        from - Start of range (inclusive).
        

        to - End of range (exclusive).
        

        fn - Binary predicate; returns true if first argument is better result than second argument.
        

        Returns:
        

        Result index.
        

        Since:
        

        1.0.0
        

        

        • 

      




        

      • 

        compare
        

        public static int compare​(int[] a,
                          int[] b,
                          IntBinaryOperator cmp)
        

        Compares a pair of arrays of ints, first by length and then by elements if necessary.
        

        

        Parameters:
        

        a - The first array.
        

        b - The second array
        

        cmp - Comparator for element comparision.
        

        Returns:
        

        Negative if the first array is less than the second, positive if it is more or zero if both arrays are equivalent.
        

        Since:
        

        1.0.0
        

        

        • 

      




        

      • 

        compare
        

        public static int compare​(long[] a,
                          long[] b,
                          LongToIntBinaryOperator cmp)
        

        Compares a pair of arrays of longs, first by length and then by elements if necessary.
        

        

        Parameters:
        

        a - The first array.
        

        b - The second array
        

        cmp - Comparator for element comparision.
        

        Returns:
        

        Negative if the first array is less than the second, positive if it is more or zero if both arrays are equivalent.
        

        Since:
        

        1.0.0

      • 

        compare
        

        public static <T> int compare​(T[] a,
                              T[] b,
                              Comparator<T> cmp)
        

        Compares a pair of arrays of objects, first by length and then by elements if necessary.
        

        

        Parameters:
        

        a - The first array.
        

        b - The second array
        

        cmp - Comparator for element comparision.
        

        Returns:
        

        Negative if the first array is less than the second, positive if it is more or zero if both arrays are equivalent.
        

        Since:
        

        1.0.0
        

        

        • 

      




        

      • 

        compare
        

        public static int compare​(IntSupplier... fns)
        

        Combines several comparators. In practice this methods executes the supplied lambdas one by one
 and returns the first non-zero value, or zero if all lambdas return zero.
        

        

        Parameters:
        

        fns - Array of comparators.
        

        Returns:
        

        First non-zero value returned by a comparator.
        

        Since:
        

        1.0.0
        

        See Also:
        

        compare(int, IntUnaryOperator)
        

        

        • 

      




        

      • 

        compare
        

        public static int compare​(int ln,
                          IntUnaryOperator fn)
        

        Combines several comparators. In practice this methods executes the supplied lambdas one by one
 and returns the first non-zero value, or zero if all lambdas return zero.
        

        

        Parameters:
        

        ln - Number of comparators.
        

        fn - Applies nth comparator.
        

        Returns:
        

        First non-zero value returned by a comparator.
        

        Since:
        

        1.0.0
        

        See Also:
        

        compare(IntSupplier...)
